recipes.blog_engine::default: Loads the database and installs the Blog Engine application as the default IIS site

long_description:
= DESCRIPTION:

Loads the Blog Engine data into the local SQL Serveer database and installs the Blog Enging application as the
default web application for IIS.

= REQUIREMENTS:

* db_sqlserver cookbook and web_iis cookbook.

= USAGE:

Designed to be run within a RightScale ServerTemplate.
description: Install and configure the Blog Engine application
name: blog_engine

db_sqlserver\/server_name.description: The network name of the SQL Server instance used by recipes.

web_iis\/deploy\/web_app_src_zips.description: The path to the directory containing one or more web application source .zip file(s).

db_sqlserver\/backup\/backup_file_name_p.description: Format string with Powershell-style string format arguments for creating backup files. The 0 argument represents the database name and the 1 argument represents a generated time stamp.

db_sqlserver\/database_name.description: The name of a database running on this SQL Server instance

db_sqlserver\/backup\/database_backup_di.description: The local drive path or UNC path to the directory which will contain new SQL Server database backup (.bak) files. Note that network drives are not supported by SQL Server.
